intro: Burdachia duckei, commonly known as the Mexican burdachia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Burdachia duckei is typically found in dry, open habitats and is known for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
